text: Two cars moving in the same direction have speeds of 100 kmh\(^{-1}\) and 130 kmh\(^{-1}\). What is the velocity of the faster car as measured by an observer in the slower car?
explanation:
Since the cars are moving in the same direction, the velocity of a body A, Va,relative to another body B, Vb is given by V = Va - Vb∴ the velocity of faster car is measured by the observer in the slower car is V = 130kmh-1 - 100 kmh-1 = 30 kmh-1
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A stone and a feather are dropped from the same height above the earth surface. Ignoring air resistance, which of the following is correct?

options.A: the feather will be blown away by the wind while stone will drop steadily
options.B: the stone and the feather will both reach the ground at the same time
options.C: the feather will reach the ground first
options.D: the stone will reach the ground first

explanation:
The acceleration of free fall due to gravity is independent of mass of the body. Therefore, ignoring air resistance, which affects feather more than the stone, the stone and the feather will both reach the ground at the same time
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A car moves with an initial velocity of 25 ms\(^{-1}\) and reaches a velocity of 45 ms\(^{-1}\) in 10s. What is the acceleration of the car?
explanation:
Acceleration = (increase in velocity)/time taken= (45 - 25)/10 = (20)/10 = 2ms-2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The surfaces of conveyor belts are made rough so as to?

options.C: enable them to carry more load

explanation:
Rough surface promotes friction. Therefore, roughness of conveyor belt prevents the load from slipping
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A machine of velocity ratio 6 requires an effort of 400 N to raise a load of 800 N through I m. Find the efficiency of the machine
explanation:
Efficiency = (MA)/V.R x 100% = (load)/Effort x (1)/V.R= (800)/400 x (1)/6 x 100% = 33.3%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a wire 30 cm long is extended to 30.5 cm by a force of 300 N. find the strain energy of wire
explanation:
Energy stored in a stretched wire (strain energy)= average force x extension= (1)/2 Fe= (1)/2 x 300 N (30.5 - 30.0) x 10-2 m= (300)/2 x 0.5 x 10-2 = 0.75J
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a hydraulic press, the pump piston exerts a pressure of 100 pa on the liquid. what force is exerted in the second piston of cross sectional area 3 m2?
explanation:
Thrust = pressure x area = 100 pa x 3 m2 = 300 N
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The accurate measurement of the relative density of a substance in its powdered form is done with a beam balance and?
explanation:
Since relative density = mass of substancemass of equal volume of water relative density bottle should be used to determine the mass of the substance, and mass of an equal volume of water by filling the bottle with the powder and water respectively and weighed with the beam balance.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A hydrometer is an instrument used in measuring?
explanation:
The instrument used in measuring relative density is hydrometer
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One special advantage of alcohol over mercury as a thermometric liquid is its?
explanation:
The low freezing point of alcohol, -115°c enable low temperatures to be measured. mercury freezes at 39°c, and cannot be used in countries like Russia where winter temperatures of -40°c are common
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The density of a certain oil on frying becomes 0.4 kgm\(^{-3}\) with the volume of 20m\(^{3}\). what will be its initial volume when its initial density is 0.8 kgm\(^{-3}\) assuming no loss of oil due to spillage?
explanation:
Density (D) = \(\frac{mass}{volume}\)
\(\therefore Mass = Density \times volume\)
= \(0.4 \times 20 = 8kg\)
The initial volume = \(\frac{Mass}{\text{Initial density}}\)
= \(\frac{8}{0.8} = 10m^{3}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Heat is radiated by hot objects in the form?
explanation:
Infrared rays falling on the skin causes the skin causes the sensation of warmth. since the objects are hot, the correct option is informed.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a container is filled with ice to the brim, what happens to the level of water when the ice completely melts?

options.A: the level of water goes up
options.B: the water in the glass outflows
options.C: the level of water remains unchanged

explanation:
Due to anomalous expansion of water at temperature range (0 - 4)°c, when a given mass of water turns into ice, its volume will increase, while the mass remains constant. Thus, when a given volum of ice melts, the volume of water formed will be less than the volume of ice. Hence, the level of water in the container will drop.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The small droplet of water that forms on the grass in the early hours of the morning is
explanation: There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A vapor is said to be saturated when?

options.A: a dynamic equilibrium exists between liquid molecules and the vapour molecules
options.B: a dynamic equilibrium exists such that more molecules return to the liquid than are leaving it
options.C: the temperature of the vapour varies

explanation:
A saturated vapour is one which is in dynamic equilibrium with its own liquid; that is as many go from the liquid to the vapour state every second return back to liquid.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The pressure of one mole of an ideal gas of volume 10\(^-2\) m\(^3\) at a temperature of 27°c is
[molar gas constant = 8.3 J mol\(^{-1}\) k\(^{-1}\)]
explanation:
T = 27 + 273 = 300 K, volume, V = 10-2 m3 molar gass constant, R = 8.3 Jmol- 1k - 1 number of mole, n = 1PV = NRTi.e P = (NRT)/V = (1 x 8.3 x 300)/10-2= 2.49 x 10\(^5\) Nm\(^-2\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following has no effect on radiation?
explanation:
Radiation depends on nature of the surface area and temperature. It is independent of density.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The wavelength of a wave traveling with a velocity of 420 ms\(^{-1}\) is 42 m. What is its period?
explanation:
V = fλf = (v)/λ = (420)/42 = 10 HZPeriod, T = (1)/F = (1)/10 = 0.1 secs
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The sound of an electricity bell dies down slowly when air is slowly pumped out from a bottle because

options.A: the wavelength of sound becomes greater in the bottle
options.B: sound cannot pass through the bottle
options.D: sound can pass through a vacuum

explanation:
Sound wave requires a material medium for its propagation. so when air is being pumped out the density of the medium is being reduced and the sound dies down. when all the air has been pumped out of the glass, no sound will be heard, as sound sound cannot travel through vacuum
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: During a thunderstorm, the sound is heard over a long time. this phenomenon is referred to as?
explanation:
The lengthening effect of sound is known as reverberation.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In comparing the camera and the human eye, the film of the camera function as the?
explanation:
The retina is light sensitive layer living the inner wall of the eye where image is formed. in the camera, image is formed on a light sensitive film.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An object 4 cm high is placed 15 cm from a concave mirror of focal length 5 cm. The size of the image is?
explanation:
(1)/v + (1)/u = (1)/f(1)/v + (1)/15 = (1)/5(1)/v = (1)/5 - (1)/15 = (3 - 1)/15 = (2)/15∴ v = (15)/2 = 7.5 cmmagnification = (v)/u = (image size)/object size(7.5)/15 = (X)/4∴ image size. X = (7.5 x 4)/15 = 2 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An object is embedded in a block of ice, 10 cm below the plane surface. if the refractive index of the ice is 1.50, the apparent depth below the surface is?
explanation:
Refraction index, n = (real depth)/apparent depth1.5 = (10)/XX = (10)/1.5 = 6.67 cm
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is used for the correction of short sightedness?
explanation:
Concave lens diverges parallel rays of light. A short sighted person has the image formed before the retina,and the rays have to be diverged so that they intersect to form image onto the retina
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Dispersion occurs when white light passes through a glass prism because of the?

options.A: different hidden colours in the glass
options.B: different speeds of the colour in the glass

explanation:
Dispersion is the splitting of white light into its spectral component colors and is caused by different speed of the colors in the prism.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: When a positively charged rod is brought nearer the cap of a positively charged electroscope, the leaves divergence will?
explanation:
Since the charged rod is not in contact with the electroscope, the leaves divergence will diverge.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Power supply is transmitted at a very high voltage and low current in order to?
explanation:
H eat generated in a wire carrying current, H = 12 Rt.so, when voltage is high and current is low heat generated in the wire will be minimal.Therefore, high voltage and low current prevent overheating of the coil.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A galvanometer with full-scale deflection of 10 mA is to be converted to a voltmeter with full-scale deflection of 5v.  if a series resistance of 498Ω is used for the conversion, the resistance of the galvanometer is ?
explanation:
r = resistance of the galvanometer
l = current through galvanometer = 1mA or 0.01A
V1 = p.d across the galvanometer = I X r = 0.01 X r
: V1 = 0.01r
V2 =  p.d across the  multiplier = 5 - 0.01r
R = resistance of the multiplier = 498Ω
where R = \(\frac{V}{I}\) --> 498 = \(\frac{5 - 0.01r}{0.01}\)
CROSS MULTIPLY --> 498 X 0.01 = 5 - 0.01r
0.01r = 5 - 4.98
∴ r = \(\frac{0.02}{0.01}\) = 2Ω
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two inductors of inductance 5 mll and 15 mll are connected in series and a current of 5A flows through them. the total energy stored in the inductor is?
explanation:
Total inductance,L = L1 + L2 = m15 + 5 = 20mH = (20)H/10001 = 5AEnergy of inductor, (1)/2 L I2= (1)/2 X (20)/1000 X 5-2= 0.25 J
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In alternating current circuit at resonance, the angle of lead or lag is?
explanation:
Resonance occurs whenever the phase angle of the circuit iszero, The only way that f = 0 is if XL = XC
Note that tanϕ = \(\frac{ X }{ R}\) where X = reactance and ϕ = angle of lead or lag.
therefore, tan ϕ = \(\frac{ X_L - X_C}{ R}\) but at resonance  \(X_L = X_C\)
tan ϕ = \(\frac{0}{R}\) = 0 and ϕ = \(tan^{-1}\) = 0º
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a discharge tube, most of the gas is pumped out so that electricity is conducted at?
explanation:
pumping out of the gas in the discharge tube reduces the pressure inside the tube, therefore, electricity is conducted at low pressure
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The ground state energy for the hydrogen atom is 5.44 x 10\(^{-19}\)J. If an electron drops from zero energy to the ground state, calculate the frequency of the emitted radiation. [h = 6.6 x 10\(^{-34}\) Js]
explanation:
∆E = hff = (∆E)/h = (5.44 x 10-19)/6.6 x 10-34 = 8.24 x 1014
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Transistors are used for the?
explanation:
transistor serve the same purpose as triode valve, which is amplification of signals.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is a pure semiconductor?
explanation:
A semiconductor is a material whose conductivity is between good conductor and insulator. Example of pure semi conductors are silicon and germanium
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The diagram above shows a velocity - time graph. The statement that is true about this motion is that the car?

options.A: has no acceleration between point F and G
options.C: has a constant soeed between points E and F
options.D: Accelerates between points F and G

explanation:
Above are the V-t graphs forI Uniform accelerationII uniform retardationIII Uniform velocityThus the car has no acceleration between point F and G since that portion of the graph represents uniform velocity

text: The diagram above represents balls in an undulating surface. Which of the following option represents positions of stable equilibrium?
explanation:
A bod y is said to be in stable equilibrium if after a slight displacement, the body returns to its former position. Thus, position III, VI and XI represents position of stable equilibrium
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A bob of weight 0.1 N hangs from a massless string of length 50 cm. A variable horizontal force which increase from zero is applied to pull the bob until the string makes an angle of 60o with the vertical. The work done is?
explanation:
Length of the stringL = y + x = 0.5m∴ x = L - y= distance moved in the direction of force (which is the weight) when the body is released But cos 60o = y/0.5∴ y = 0.5cos60 = 0.5 x 1/2 = 0.25∴ x = l - y = 0.5 - 0.25 = 0.25mWork done = force x distance moved in the direction of force.= 0.1 x 0.25 = 0.025J
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Two metals P and Q of length l1 and l2 are heated through the same temperature difference. If the ratio of the linear expansivities of P to Q is 2:3 and the ratio of lengths is 3:4. What is the ratio of increase in length of P to Q?
explanation:
Metals P, Qoriginal length lP, lQIncrease in length ΔlP, ΔlQLinear expansivities αP, αQ∴ αP/αQ = 2/3 ; and lP/lQ = 3/4But increase in length, Δl = αlΔθ∴ΔlP = αPlPΔθΔlQ = αQlQΔθ
∴ΔlP=αPlPΔθ=2x3=1ΔlQαQlQΔθ342
∴ Ratio of increase in length of P to Q = 1:2
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: THe velocity of sound in air at 16oC is 340ms-1. What will it be when the pressure is doubled and its temperature raised to 127ºC?
explanation:
The velocity of sound in air, V∝√T, where T is absolute temperatureThus V = K√T or K = V/TV is independent of pressure and density at a fixed temperature.∴ V1/√T1 = V2/√T2T1 = 16 + 273 = 289K, V1 = 340ms-1T2 = 127 + 273 = 400K, V2 = ?
340=V2√289√400
∴ V2 =340√400_√289
= 400m/s
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Three capacitors of capacitance 2μF, 4μFand 8μF are connected in parallel and a P.D of 6V is maintained across each capacitor, the total energy stored is?
explanation:
C = C1 + C2 + C3= 2 + 4 + 8 = 14μFV = 6VEnergy = 1/2CV21/2 x 14 x 10-6 x 62= 2.52 x 10-4 J
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A cell of e.m.f 12V and internal resistance 4Ω is connected to an external resistor of resistance 2Ω. Find the current flow.
explanation:
I = E/(R+r)= 12/6 = 2A

explanation:

text: In the diagram above, if the south-poles of two magnets strokes steel bar, the polarities at T and V will respectively be
explanation:
IN magnetisation by stroking, the last touched has a pole opposite to that of the magnet used. Therefore, the poles T and V are N and N respectively

text: In Faradays law of electrolysis, a graph of the mass deposited against the quantity of electricity is plotted. The slope of the graph gives?
explanation:
In Faradays law of electrolysisM = It = QWhere M is the mass of substance deposit . Q is the quantity of charge. A graph of m against Q is a straight line passing through the origin with slope equal to the electrochemical equivalent.Z

text: The process whereby a substance changes from a solid to liquid when heat is applied, is called?
explanation:
The process of a substance changing from solid to liquid upon heating is called fusion. It happens when the temperature reaches the melting point, allowing particles to gain enough energy to move freely as a liquid.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

options.A: Both the mass and weight vary
options.B: The weight is constant while the mass varies
options.C: The mass is constant while the weight varies
options.D: Both the mass and weight are constant

explanation:
click here

text: The radioisotope \( ^{235}_{92}U \) decays by emitting two alpha particles, three beta particles and a gamma ray. What is the mass and atomic number of the resulting element?
explanation:
-Alpha radiationconsists of helium- He\(^{4}_{2}\)
2 Alpha decay --> 2  X  He\(^{4}_{2}\) = Element\(^{8}_{4}\)
- Beta particles are high energy electrons-  e\(^{0}_{-1}\)
3 Beta particles --> 3  X  e\(^{0}_{-1}\) = Element\(^{0}_{-3}\)
- Gamma rays are waves of electromagnetic energy, or photons.
the mass and atomic number of the resulting element = U\(^{235}_{92}\) - Elements( \(^{8}_{4}\) +  \(^{0}_{-3}\) )
--> Element\(^{227}_{91}\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
